runs.comm: almost sneaks through first ball, Lumb went onto the back foot and this took an inside edge to the leg side
cramped for room first ball, spins back into Hales and cuts it off his stumps
finds the gap this time, staying on the back foot and cuts between backward point and short third man
not getting forward, pushes this square into the off side
drifts into the pads, clipped in front of square
flicks a full delivery on middle through midwicket and places it wide enough of long-on for a second
starts full outside off, hint of swing, Hales chases it but his foot wasn't anywhere close to the ball and he missed
close! This time Hales connects with his drive, squirts off the toe and goes behind square falling just in front of backward point then bursts through Smith's hands
keeping it full on off stump, hint of movement, Hales drives and it comes off a thick edge to third man
strong drive from Lumb, advancing down the pitch, holds his shape and picks out deep cover
gets forward, carefully opens the face and it runs to backward point

he's not happy with this! Lumb well across his stumps, it's a full toss, and he's sure he's got an inside edge on this before it clips the pad. Replays aren't clear straight away, so it will have been a thin one of he hit it. Was certainly straight enough
full on the stumps, defended to the leg side
worked through the leg side
beaten...a beauty from Badree, spins away on off stump and scoots past the edge
pushed into the off side
nudged back to the bowler
flicked from outside off down to long-on
full on leg stump, clips the pad and beats a diving Ramdin but Russell chases it hard from short fine-leg and flicks it back just before the rope
leg side again, and this time Moeen picks it up cleanly off his pads, sending it behind square...sweetly struck
gone this time! Santokie on fire. A lovely slower ball completely defeated Moeen. Was full on off stump, just gripped off the surface, Moeen was far to early on his shot and that was right in front
gives Morgan a slower ball first up, he watches it closely and defends to the leg side
full and wide, Morgan reaches for it away from his body and just gets the toe end of the bat
finds the edge, but it's well controlled by Morgan who played with soft hands to guide it wide of first slip...Badree runs around the boundary then sticks a boot out

big appeal! This time not out. Hales staying on the back foot, was a quicker ball that skidded on and Hales was flicking across the line. Not a bad shout. Hawk Eye says it would have clattered leg stump.
tucked off the stumps into midwicket
full on leg stump, turned off the pads out to deep square
another lovely delivery, sliding across Morgan and beats the outside edge
cut to short third man
England in the mire again! The captain goes. He goes for the sweep, it comes off a top edge and deep square-leg has plenty of time to settle under a comfortable catch
squares him up with some late movement, was a full delivery, runs off a thick outside edge
full on off stump, Hales is forward and drives to cover
drives again, this time opens the face at the last moment to try and find the gap but can't beat point
push and run into the covers. Might have been close if Sammy had picked the ball up cleanly
angled across outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
another close shave...Hales chops a bottom edge that scuttles past the stumps and then there's some confusion over the run before they make it home
pushed off the back foot down to long on
goes down early to try and play a cute paddle, gets it through short fine-leg...England have barely hit a ball straight in this innings
on the back foot, played into the covers
worked out to midwicket
slog sweep this time, fetched from well outside off and it goes straight to deep midwicket
touch shorter, Buttler cracks it through point to the sweeper
round the wicket, very full, and driven nicely through the off side...Santokie tries to kick it back, but the ball has hit the rope first
drags the length back, prodded into the off side
flicked out to midwicket
on off stump, quickish, blocked by to the bowler
driven back down the pitch...dynamic from England
touch shorter outside off, pushed to deep cover
starts short, Buttler shapes for a pull and it flies off a healthy top edge down to third man...not far from carrying for six
fuller this time, angled to backward point where Sammy prevents the single
back of a length, straighter delivery, nudged into the leg side

dropped by Ramdin. The ball went miles into the air, Hales mowing across the line of a full ball, a cutter, and it flew behind the batsman towards third man. Ramdin called early and actually over-ran the ball
very wide outside off, called
another positive drive through the off side, placed wide of the cover sweeper
short of a length, another cutter I think, pushed to the off side
outside off, angled to short third man...England reach fifty
worked to midwicket
shorter outside off, neatly guided backward of point but still can't find the boundary
short again, Hales rocks back and cuts in front of square this time
steady on, folks, it's a six! Hales comes down the pitch and swings cleanly through the line to send it comfortably over long-on
flicked off the back foot to deep square
back of a length, wide of the stumps and Hales pulls hard across the line... and carves himself a slice of fresh air
fuller length, tailing in and flicked off middle and leg for a single through square
bit of width, Buttler angles the bat and takes a single in front of point
pitched up on off stump, again Hales closes the face of the bat and works one through midwicket, they think about two but the throw is good
Buttler backs away and Rampaul spots the movement, fires the ball full on the pads, beating the bat... good bowling
full and straight and clipped through midwicket to the sweeper for one more
drops short straight away and Buttler pulls hard and flat in front of deep midwicket, good connection, starts the over with a boundary
back of a length again, swatted through the leg side

what a catc... oh, he's dropped it! Sensational attempt from Chris Gayle at backward point from Hales' slice, he hung in the air, like a leopard lazily draped across a tree branch, clutched the ball but couldn't hold on as he fell to ground
Buttler steps away and clubs a tennis-style shot straight back past the bowler, who throws his hands up but really had no chance there
scooped for six, what a shot! Buttler goes back and across outside off and flips a length ball all the way over the rope at long leg... amazing power
slower ball, pitched up outside off and Buttler drills it back, Sammy gets a hand on it but can't prevent another run
pitched up on the stumps, dug out down towards long-on
drops a little short and Hales belabours a flat six over midwicket this time! Standing tall, swatting across the line and sends is whistling into the stands
Hales makes room and Rampaul follows the batsman again, right in the blockhole, rolls short on the leg side
goes back and slaps a shortish ball through point for a single
nearly down the throat of fine leg... but it's just short! Hales pulled flat and hard again, good diving effort from Smith, manages to prevent it going past him, too
full on the stumps ... and it's sent back with interest into the crowd at long-on! Towering six from Buttler, looked like he had mishit it but it soared beyond the boundary
nearly a mix up, chopped behind square but straight to the fielder and Hales would have been out with a direct hit!
comes forward to a slower ball, taps one into the covers
pitched up, quicker and straighter, pinged through cover for one more
Buttler top-edges hiiiiiigh into the sky... but Bravo drops it at cover! Another slower ball, I think, almighty swing across the line from Buttler, given a life by the bowler

scooped off his pads, not enough pace to clear the boundary fielder, who takes a dolly! Bravo does get a wicket, though it is arguably the less dangerous of the two... slightly scratchy 40 from Hales but he did well to hang in and drag England back into some sort of contention
another slower ball, fifth out of six, Buttler dabs into a gap in the covers and they run well for a second
slightly short of a length outside off, Bopara guides to backward point, who misfields to ensure they get an easy one
full length, right up in the blockhole, Buttler gets his bat down on it and squeezes the ball back past Russell, despite a commendable dive in his follow through
fullish, tailing in from outside off, pushed through the covers for one more
full length and curling away a touch as Buttler swings and misses outside off
pitched up, around off stump, chops down on it and tickles one towards mid-on... That's fifty for Buttler, his second in T20 internationals
slightly full, on middle stump, driven towards long-on, who comes in and keeps them to one
Bopara drops deep in the crease and cracks a pull shot for four to deep square leg, waited on the slower ball and put it away
slow cutter again, nudged off the pads for one through square
length outside off, maybe rolling the fingers over it again, the ball pops off the surface and Buttler jabs it short of midwicket
on the stumps, Bopara dabs another cutter behind square on the leg side
full length, no pace on it, Buttler works one off the pads towards deep midwicket for another single
beats the bat outside off, offcutter drawing Bopara forward, valuable dot ball
Russell gets it full and straight, bunted down the ground, straight to long-on
comes forward and drives into the ground, back to the bowler but Russell can't hold it
Buttler whips out his icecream scoop as Russell pitches full outside off, only gets the toe end on it and squirts one to short fine leg
punches one more down the ground to long-on
quick, full and slightly wide, Buttler looses his footing as he slams the ball to the cover fielder
boundary ball! Low full toss from Russell and Buttler smears it straight back down the ground, couple of bounces to the fence #whenyorkersgowrong
Ramdin is up to the stumps, sliced low to short third man, they chance a run and make it safely enough
swings across the line and picks up one more through midwicket
rolls the fingers over the ball, bobbles short into the off side and Bopara turns around to regain the crease as bowler and keeper converge on it
slightly short of a length, slow and loopy bounce, rocks back and pulls into the ground through square
outside off, Buttler steps away and swipes a couple towards deep extra cover
in the slot, another slower ball from Bravo and this one it picked, plucked and packed off for six! Buttler heaves his third maximum over long-on, pepping up what had been a quiet over
angled across from over the wicket, goes back and runs a single to third man

swings hard, aiming down the ground... but a sliced top edge finds Sammy going back at backward point to take the catch! A cutter from Santokie, just held up and Buttler was through the shot early. That's the man they wanted
drops short and Bopara rather misses out trying to pull, the ball deflecting off his body
clears the front foot and smites a half volley straight down the ground for a boundary first ball. Out of nick? Not a bit of it
comes forward and steers one through the covers
now Bopara frees the arms, can't clear long-off - Santokie has another! Bit of a miscue, didn't hit cleanly through the line and picked out the fielder
pitched up and dug out down the ground for a single
that's why he's not been bowling length... Bresnan opens his shoulders and clouts a flat six over long-on. Brings up the 150, England could do with a couple more of those
full and straight this time, punches back, in the air and Bravo gets a fingertip on it, tough to call it a chance
dot ball, Wright duped by a slower ball, nearly swings himself off his feet as it loops through outside off
backs away and clunks a cut through point

quick and slightly full, Bresnan goes hard, trying to hit down the ground, and nicks off! Bravo gets his second wicket off the final ball, roars out his approval. West Indies will have to chase 153 for the series
